programme.desc: High in the mountains of Morocco lives a descendant of a long line of macaque rulers. She has been in charge of this troupe for many winters - one of the longest recorded reigns of an alpha - but this year is likely to be her last.

programme.title: Hidden Habitats
programme.desc: Hidden habitats that are self-contained ecosystems are explored. In the opener, a visit to the Galapagos Islands.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Dynasties
programme.desc: A pride of lions battles for survival.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Dynasties
programme.desc: David, a chimpanzee alpha in Senegal, tries to overcome threats to his leadership.

programme.title: Life In Color With David Attenborough
programme.desc: This episode reveals how, millions of years ago, the first animals had eyes that were unable to distinguish color - yet as that changed, 'seeing in color' gave animals many advantages, whether to find food, attract a mate or warn off an enemy.

programme.title: Life In Color With David Attenborough
programme.desc: With new science and specialist cameras, David Attenborough explores some of the surprising ways that animals use color, as he travels from the ocean to the rainforest and beyond.

programme.title: Life In Color With David Attenborough
programme.desc: This episode reveals that some animals use color to hide and disappear into the background, or to trick and deceive. David Attenborough reveals some of the natural world's most cunning tricksters and masters of disguise.

programme.title: Planet Earth: A Celebration
programme.desc: A compilation of sequences from "Planet Earth II" and "Blue Planet II" with new narration and music.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: How life struggles to survive under these extreme conditions. In the early months of the year, the Earth's axial tilt brings the height of summer in some places and the depths of winter in others.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: Traveling around the globe to witness the atmospheric shifts that take place in March, from the wave of cherry blossoms that unfold across Japan to the final raft of green sea turtles that arrive on the Great Barrier Reef islands to lay eggs.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: May is a time of seasonal gear shifting and powerful forces of nature.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: Featuring some of the planet's most dramatic natural shifts in July, from the Arctic ice sheets that come crashing down during the summer melt to the feeding frenzy when sockeye salmon reach the end of their journey in Alaska.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: Another seasonal change unfolds. The Northern Hemisphere moves into autumn, while Australia witnesses a rebirth of life, and mating humpbacks fill the warming tropical seas of Tonga.

programme.title: A Wild Year on Earth
programme.desc: Witness some of the most incredible natural events in November, from the millions of Monarch butterflies that converge in Mexico's forests to the deep fog that shrouds the city of Dubai, signalling the start of winter.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: In the Season 9 finale, a conspiracy blogger's death arouses suspicion when he dies before a scheduled meeting with Booth to discuss a previous case, but evidence uncovered during the team's investigation could affect his future with the FBI. programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Murder in the Middle East

Meanwhile, Brennan is concerned about Booth's gambling habit, and asks Aubrey to protect her and Christine from her husband's bookie.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A cookie-jar collector's body is found near a river, and the killer may be a fellow kitchenware enthusiast. Meanwhile, Booth struggles to accept Brennan's decision that he move out of their house due to his gambling addiction; and Aubrey keeps an eye on one of the "squinterns."

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The remains of an ex-con and biker who became a yoga instructor are found in the ruins of a forest fire, and the investigation casts a wide net in both worlds to find the killer. Meanwhile, Booth continues to fight his gambling addiction; and Angela and Hodgins make an important decision about their future at the Jeffersonian.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: In the Season 10 finale, a victim's remains at a crime scene are reminiscent of Christopher Pelant's dirty work, so the team revisits their files on the infamous killer to find his possible protÃ©gÃ©. Meanwhile, Angela wonders if Paris is the right place for her and Hodgins; and Brennan and Booth mull career moves out of the Jeffersonian and the FBI, respectively.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth goes missing as Season 11 begins six months after he and Brennan left their careers behind, but a case with ties to the couple pulls Brennan back into the world of forensic analysis, which brings her into contact with a member of Booth's family and Arastoo Vaziri, who's taken the lead at the Jeffersonian in her absence. Meanwhile, the FBI investigate Booth's disappearance, but one agent's tactics are bad for the team's morale.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth is still missing, but the team learns that Agent Miller has hidden information about his whereabouts and physical state. programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Remains found at a fish farm coincide with Brennan and Booth returning to their jobs at the Jeffersonian and the FBI, respectively, and it's revealed that some of the victim's organs were harvested before he was dumped in the water. programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A real-estate agent's remains are discovered in a forest and show signs of being partially devoured by coyote-wolf hybrids, so Brennan solicits help from an older, distinguished forensic anthropologist, who amazes the staff with her decades of experience and surprising knowledge of fantasy football, with which the victim was heavily involved and even linked him to a social-media feud with an NFL star.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A case involving a 200-year-old headless corpse gets some help from Ichabod Crane and FBI agent Abbie Mills, who travel from Sleepy Hollow to claim the body, but wonder what it has to do with a contemporary murder victim. Meanwhile, Brennan and Booth surprise each other with Halloween pranks.

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: High Treason in the Holiday Season

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth go undercover at an Old West-theme shooting competition. Meanwhile, Angela and Hodgins discuss their future and what it holds for their family; and Cam gets to know Sebastian better.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The investigation of a murdered police officer gets some help from a behavioral analyst. Meanwhile, Cam faces some difficult decisions in her personal life.

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Last Shot at a Second Chance

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Fixer Upper
programme.desc: Baylor University graduates tour homes in Waco, Texas, with the hope that their 12-year-old son will one day live in the house and continue their family's collegiate legacy.

programme.title: Fixer Upper
programme.desc: A move to Waco, Texas, by a family of three looking for a slower pace of life, big acreage, and a home with modern flare, which offers Chip and Joanna some major construction and design challenges.

programme.title: Fixer Upper
programme.sub-title: A Home for Him and Her

programme.title: Fixer Upper
programme.desc: Soon-to-be empty nesters are looking for a home in Waco to not only be near their kids, but also give their daughters a place to escape campus life from time to time.

programme.title: Fixer Upper
programme.desc: The Aguilars are searching for a forever home that would fit their family of four and reflect their personal style. With a total budget of $275,000 they are hoping to find a home that is affordable, to give Chip and Jo plenty of room to customize it.

programme.title: Fixer Upper
programme.desc: Chip and Joanna have a longtime friend who has a dream of living in a houseboat on Lake Waco. With an all-in budget of $85,000, the trio tour some of the available options and then face plenty of design challenges as they take on a tight space that, hopefully, floats.

programme.title: Fixer Upper
programme.desc: Todd and Lexia Meek look for a house with several acres of land.

programme.title: Fixer Upper
programme.desc: Jo's sister Mikey and brother-in-law David are moving back to Waco with their five kids. With a few design tweaks, the property Chip and Jo have just started to flip, in a great neighborhood and Waco's best school district, happens to be perfect for their extended family. This project is their most personal one yet, and a true labor of love.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.sub-title: Salvaging Items From a High School Into Purposed Goods

programme.desc: Salvaging a clay-fired roof and oversized cornice brackets.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs

programme.title: Fixer Upper
programme.desc: Baylor sweethearts return to their alma mater to buy their first fixer upper.

programme.sub-title: New Nest for a Growing Family

programme.title: Fixer Upper

programme.title: Fixer Upper: The Castle

programme.title: Fixer Upper: The Castle

programme.title: Fixer Upper: The Castle

programme.title: Fixer Upper: The Castle
programme.desc: Unexpected water damage is an expensive setback for Jo and Chip, but the installation of restored wood pieces and reclaimed tile from Europe begins to restore the original grandeur of the castle.

programme.title: Fixer Upper: The Castle

programme.title: Fixer Upper: The Castle

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia.

programme.desc: Green chili and mile-high burgers are found in Fort Collins, Colo. Also: Guy visits a breakfast-lunch cafÃ© in Falmouth, Mass., known for its pickle chips and savory scone sandwich; and travels to a family-owned restaurant for soft-shell crab and kale soup.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Sandwiches are highlighted during a trip to Colorado Springs, where a Pueblo chili burger is tasted by Guy. Later, the host tries a corned beef hoagie and porchetta in Washington, D.C.; and savory tequila shrimp, pork and brisket are eaten at an Atlantic City pub.

programme.title: Guy's Hometown
programme.desc: Guy Fieri returns to Ferndale, California, for food, fun and a trip down memory lane. At the Humboldt County Fair, Guy finds a fired-up chili cook-off, unexpected eats and a chance to give back to first responders and veterans with a big barbecue meal.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Meats that are grilled, smoked and fried are in the spotlight. Included: a Miami charcuterie known for its wild boar sausage and house-cured bacon. Also: a funky joint in Modesto, Cal., featuring monster tacos and a sweet and savory waffle; and an ex-NFL player who's slinging wings that score with sauce.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy puts the spotlight on indulgent dishes during a trip to Charlotte, where he visits a seafood spot known for its gumbo and a spicy mahimahi specialty; and a mother-daughter team serve up lamb ragout and a decadent ice cream sandwich. Also: drunken chicken and a killer burger from a Korean-German combo in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy travels to Bakersfield, Cal., where he visits a Basque restaurant serving oxtail and garlic fried chicken. Also: He explores Greek specialties, including cabbage dolmades and braised beef over pasta; and stops by a nearby Asian joint, known for its pad Thai and tom yum kung.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Food from diverse cultures. Included: a Greek joint in Denver known for delicious lamb ribs and a unique dessert. Also: tasty tacos al pastor and carnitas tamales in Richfield, Minn.; and an Atlanta spot's spin on shrimp and grits.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri's digging into appetizers, dessert and everything in-between. In Laramie, WY, an old-school cafe is loadin' up green-chili burritos and scratch-made pie. Then, a spot in Anchorage, AK, is going next level with their blackened chicken gnocchi.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri looks for culinary creations, including a New Hampshire catering truck full of beef tips, shrimp, and dirty bird wings. Pierogis in Ohio and homemade gnocchi at a New Jersey eatery are also featured.

programme.title: Save On Your Grocery Bills!

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa: Back to Basics
programme.desc: It's eggs all the way in an incredible master class, featuring them both soft boiled and in the dressing of a fantastic Caesar Salad with Blue Cheese and Bacon. Egg whites are whipped to perfection for a Pavlova Fruit Tart, then there's foolproof Truffled Scrambled Eggs. Ina Garten makes Eggs Benedict with an Easy Hollandaise Sauce just like a pro, and super chef Jose Andres reveals the secret of his perfectly fried eggs.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa: Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina prepares easy, make-ahead breakfasts dishes. Ina's raspberry baked French toast is perfect for welcoming company, and her mini Italian frittatas only need to be warmed up before serving.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: The show is raising a glass to a weekend favorite - brunch. Sunny Anderson starts the party right with her breakfast steak and eggs with chimichurri. Jeff Mauro adds bubbles to his strawberry and prosecco scones, complete with sparkling lemon icing.

programme.title: Trisha's Southern Kitchen
programme.desc: Trisha Yearwood takes her two loves, brunch and cereal, to a whole new level by making an incredible brunch spread with Cereal Granola Parfaits, Chocolate Hazelnut French Toast and a Cheesy Quiche.

programme.title: Trisha's Southern Kitchen
programme.desc: Trisha Yearwood takes brunch to the next level by hosting a BYOB -- Build-Your-Own-Brunch party. She uses some of her favorite Mexican-themed dishes to create an epic food and beverage buffet for her friends to enjoy.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It's Ree vs. her own restaurant, out to win Ladd's breakfast heart. She makes his favorite slap-up platter, the Farmer's Breakfast, with over-easy fried eggs, a slab of honey-glazed ham, fried sausage and bacon, plus Crispy Bits Potatoes. The whole meal is made more alluring with glorious Sticky Buns.

programme.title: Magnolia Table with Joanna Gaines
programme.desc: Joanna shares her biscuit recipe and favorite ways to eat them.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: The hosts start the day with the ultimate cozy brunch menu. Geoffrey Zakarian whips classic Belgian waffles; Katie Lee Biegel shares her indulgent everything bagel cream cheese rolls; and Sunny Anderson serves up a delicious brown sugar cold brew.

programme.title: Guy's Ranch Kitchen
programme.desc: Guy Fieri gets brunch with a crunch when Chef Aarti Sequeira cooks peanut fried steak with yogurt turmeric gravy; Chef Justin Warner leans towards lunch with his shrimp corn dogs; and Chef Jonathan Waxman does a delicious pork Milanese.

programme.title: Guy's Ranch Kitchen
programme.desc: Not a fan of eggs, Guy Fieri's mood lifts as his chef friends make an almost-eggless brunch. Aarti Sequeira makes halloumi cheese bites with beetroot chutney; Michael Voltaggio mixes grapefruit daiquiris; and Justin Warner bakes cherry almond granola.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Spotlighting a New Jersey diner with more than 30 kinds of pancakes; a breakfast joint in Phoenix with homemade waffles; and an eatery with 60 different omelets in Kansas City, Mo.

programme.desc: Great breakfast joints are visited. Included: a juice bar in New Orleans making homemade bagels; a New Mexico roadhouse that adds Philly flavors to Southwestern favorites; a family-run eatery in Pittsburgh where pancakes are made from scratch.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: The host eats pfannkuchen and bacon-filled waffles for breakfast in San Antonio. For lunch, he heads to Tampa Bay for a taste of Mexican street food served out of a bus. And he hits a popular seafood joint in Virginia beach for dinner.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: A breakfast joint in Portland, Ore., is visited for a taste of homemade buttermilk biscuits. programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Comfort food is in the spotlight when Guy visits an Atlanta joint known for its chicken and biscuits and house-cured lox; and twin brothers serve Southern grub, including a brisket burger and chicken-fried ribs. Also: vegetarian specialties from a cafÃ© in Fort Collins, Colo.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Featured: an amped-up deli in Portsmouth, N.H., known for its lamb burgers and ribs; Asian buns and a unique bacon-corn bar dish served at a Koreatown favorite in L.A.; and a bagel shop in Plainsboro, N.J., offering a spicy specialty and pork roll.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Cosmopolitan comfort food is featured, beginning with a New England spin on corned beef and cabbage and a fresh take on stroganoff in Portsmouth, N.H. Then, a mother-daughter team in Los Angeles dish out authentic Ethiopian specialties; and in Minneapolis, Guy learns what's good at an over-the-top hot dog spot.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy puts chicken in the spotlight. Included: a Baltimore landmark known for its wings and steak wrap; a soul food joint in Eugene, Ore., that serves a barbecue bird and signature burger; and a Southern spot in Des Moines, Iowa, with fried chicken and red-velvet waffles.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri hits the road in search of sandwiches, sausage and schnitzel. Included: Swiss specialties are found in Portland, Ore.; a funky Charlotte food truck serving up grilled cheese with all kinds of culinary twists; and a hot dog joint making sausage from scratch and a classic chili-cheese Coney.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy Fieri is caught up in a whirlwind of flavors. In Norfolk, Va., he stops at a two-for-one spot where a bomb butcher stacks sandwiches by day and a chef firing up ramen and sticky wings takes over at night. Then, there is a German-Swiss joint smack in the middle of Maui, Hawaii, serving rouladen and old-fashioned apple strudel.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: New Orleans gumbo and etouffee are found in Los Angeles; a vegan deli in Minneapolis serves turkey, cheese and Italian "meats"; and a trip to Maui, Hawaii, includes ramen and Vietnamese crepes from a noodle shop.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy sets off in search of comfort food for the soul and ends up at a funky neighborhood cafÃ© in Portland, Ore., that's known for its "heartless artichoke sandwich," as well as a curried lentil dish. programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits an Argentinian joint in Denver known for it's beef empanadas and veggie tarta; and a family-run barbecue restaurant in Bayport, Minn., where he's served a brisket sandwich and pulled pork. Also: He tastes a loaded chicken dish and Tex-Mex breakfast in Falmouth, Mass.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

Also: a strip mall spot specializing in crepes in Las Vegas.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. With him intent on carrying out a plan that will destroy the world, Dom must gather his loyal crew and face the sins of his past to save everything and everyone he loves.

programme.title: Dune
programme.desc: This version of Frank Herbert's popular 1965 sci-fi novel is the first of a two-part adaptation. This story covers only the first half of the novel and features Paul Atreides, whose duke father, Leto, accepts the stewardship of a planet called Arrakis. Since it's the main source of a most coveted substance called the melange, the leadership of its mining industry has been contentious, which the heir of the House Atreides will soon find out.

programme.title: Free Guy
programme.desc: Guy is a bank teller and a non-playable character in an open world video game called Free City. All is going well in his virtual world until publisher Antoine decides to insert a code developed by programmers Keys and Milly into the game. All of a sudden, he finds himself imbued with consciousness. As he grows increasingly aware of his surroundings, he is confronted with the fact that he is a background character and that he is the only person who can save their game from going offline.

The members of the Justice Society of America try to befriend him, hopefully retraining him as well. They need to come together soon to fight a more powerful villain about to wreak havoc on the world.

programme.title: The Batman

The story follows and unfolds the origins of the Kingsman, the independent intelligence agency.
